unit_learning_outcomes.description: Identify, describe and evaluate some aspects of Italian-speaking cultures and societies.
Develop comprehensive elementary level skills in reading, writing, listening and speaking in the Italian language.
Identify, evaluate and deploy the grammatical structures of Italian at elementary level.
Apply relevant language conventions to create meaningful intercultural encounters.
Demonstrate an awareness of some language and language use, in both Italian and in English.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Students are expected to spend time on daily review of grammar and vocabulary, and Italian practice. Students should be familiar with the content of a week before attending their following seminar and feel comfortable with each week's content before starting a new week.

assessments.description: The final test covers all material studied in second semester (Ch. 6-11)
Online assessment covering individual book chapters. These exercises are based on the workbook material accompanying the text book.
Weekly activities to check and confirm active engagement with course material. This includes online forum discussions.

Students are required to prepare and perform a role play in Italian. External students can video-record their presentation and send it to the tutor through the iLearn page. Alternatively a video conferencing session can be organised.
These written tests cover the material present in the books chapter studied up to that point.

data.description: This unit is the continuation in the second half-year of Italian Studies 1. It provides a further systematic study of the basic grammar and idiom of standard Italian. Together with Italian Studies 1, this unit is designed to reach the equivalent of matriculation level in language.
